Package au.edu.anu.rscs.aot.util

Class Resources

  • java.lang.Object
    • au.edu.anu.rscs.aot.util.Resources
  • public class Resources
extends java.lang.Object
    Utilities to locate resources (usually text files) in the project class hierarchy.
    Author:
    Ian Davies - 19 Dec. 2018
    Copied from old code by S. Flint.
    refactored by J. Gignoux 22/5/2019

      as a name in the form: au/edu/anu/twcore/archetype/tw/3wA-Experiment.ugt
      which can be directly used as a resource name in the other methods of this class.

    • Method Detail

      • getURL

        public static java.net.URL getURL​(java.lang.String name)
        Creates a URL for the required resource, based on the SystemClassLoader class path, i.e. the class loader running the current application.
        Parameters:
        name - the resource to look for
        Returns:
        the url, null if not found

      • getURL

        public static java.net.URL getURL​(java.lang.String name,
                                  java.lang.String packageName)
        Creates a URL based on the required resource name and the associated package name
        Parameters:
        name - the resource to look for (usually, a file)
        packageName - the package in which the resource is to be found
        Returns:
        the URL of the resource, null if not found

      • getURL

        public static java.net.URL getURL​(java.lang.String name,
                                  java.lang.Class<?> associatedWithClass)
        Creates a URL based on the required resource name and the associated class package name.
        Parameters:
        name - the resource to look for (usually, a file)
        associatedWithClass - the class in which package the resource is to be found
        Returns:
        the URL of the resource, null if not found

      • getFile

        public static java.io.File getFile​(java.lang.String name)
        Returns a file matching the required resource by searching in the application class path. WARNING: this will not work for resources in jars, that cant be Files
        Parameters:
        name - the resource to look for
        Returns:
        the File matching the resource, null if not found

      • getFile

        public static java.io.File getFile​(java.lang.String name,
                                   java.lang.Class<?> associatedWithClass)
        Returns a file matching the required resource by searching in the package of the Class argument. WARNING: this will not work for resources in jars, that cant be Files
        Parameters:
        name - the resource to look for
        associatedWithClass - the class in which package the resource is to be found
        Returns:
        the File matching the resource, null if not found

      • getFile

        public static java.io.File getFile​(java.lang.String name,
                                   java.lang.String packageName)
        Returns a file matching the required resource by searching in the specified package WARNING: this will not work for resources in jars, that cant be Files
        Parameters:
        name - the resource to look for
        packageName - the package in which the resource is to be found
        Returns:
        the File matching the resource, null if not found

      • getTextResource

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getTextResource​(java.lang.String name)
        This will get a text resource either from a plain file or from a jar
        Parameters:
        name - the resource to look for
        Returns:
        the text as a list of Strings, one per line

      • getTextResource

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getTextResource​(java.lang.String name,
                                                               java.lang.Class<?> associatedWithClass)
        This will get a text resource either from a plain file or from a jar. The resource will be searched for in the same package as the Class parameter.
        Parameters:
        name - the resource to look for
        associatedWithClass - the class in which package the resource is to be found
        Returns:
        the text as a list of Strings, one per line

      • getPackagedFile

        public static java.io.File getPackagedFile​(java.lang.String name)
        Parameters:
        name - package relative resource file (dot separated)
        Returns:
        fully qualified File obtained by the ClassLoader

      • getPackagedFileName

        public static java.lang.String getPackagedFileName​(java.lang.String name)
        returns a name in the form: au.edu.anu.twcore.archetype.tw.3wA-Experiment.ugt
        as a name in the form: au/edu/anu/twcore/archetype/tw/3wA-Experiment.ugt
        which can be directly used as a resource name in the other methods of this class.

        name -
        Returns:
